messages.message: I’m a bit confused, how are 5.2 and 5.4 related to the list earlier? Are these the only two items left with questions?

I threw in some comments. the first one, we’ve already made adjustments to restrict mounting. the second one seems to be asking us to hide some buttons, but I don’t see any security impact so we can jira it for the backlog as a nice to have, maybe a good one for front-end for kon-mari? @Jessica
@kunal made the list earlier from the PEN test report. (they cant share the report directly which may have caused some miscommunication here)
are my responses okay then?
or any other immediate questions?
Will read soon as I’m off this call! :eyes:
all good!
Thanks both, they seem like very reasonable responses to me! Will let you know how they go.
@Heymian - we already gave NatWest the patch for restricting mounting right?
yes
they dont have a great memory do they
thanks for confimring :slightly_smiling_face:
hahaha doesn’t seem like it :stuck_out_tongue:
Hi team, fly-on-the-wall, here, but on 5.2 do we support posix-style passthrough to storage or is it really just a SP mount of underlying storage?
we mount the underlying storage but we implement a client specific passthrough layer on top of it to allow us to expose our all file-based access through our API layer and abstraactions
Thanks @Heymian so if a customer already has a permissions layout on their file system, they would need to re-implement those permissions in IB
can you clarify what a “permissions layout” means?

Oh sure, in simple terms, if I have a customer that has filesystem permissions set up for POSIX users and groups, then they will typically want us to honor those permissions when those same users access storage through us.  So, for a local filesystem or for something like Azure Datalake Storage, I have always been asked (in my previous lives) to take the user login and pass it through to the underlying storage so that the correct, already configured permissions are applied at the storage level without having to redefine them at the application level.
so that’s not how the instabase file-system works. The posix users will not map to any users within the instabase platform, so we do not do any passthrough of permissions.
